info.title: OPERA Cloud Housekeeping Service API
info.description:
APIs to cater for Housekeeping functionality in OPERA Cloud.

Housekeeping enables you to schedule daily room cleaning, maintenance, and housekeeping staff activities. It provides information on room status, out of order/out of service rooms, and forecasting.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 22.1.0.0.

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright (c) 2020, 2022 Oracle and/or its affiliates.

get.description:
This API will allow you to get the current housekeeping discrepant rooms. These are rooms where the Housekeeping Status doesn't match the Front Office Status.

OperationId:getHousekeepingDiscrepancies

parameters.name: roomDiscrepancyStatus
parameters.description: Simple type for discrepant room status instructions to be used in requests for fetching housekeeping and front office room discrepancy. Valid values are Sleep, Skip, Person Discrepancy, Due Out Only.

parameters.name: roomClass
parameters.description: Room Class of the Room.

parameters.name: housekeepingEndDate
parameters.description: The ending value of the date range.

parameters.name: housekeepingStartDate
parameters.description: The starting value of the date range.

parameters.name: floor
parameters.description: The floor of room to be fetched.

parameters.name: dueOut
parameters.description: List the rooms based on the flag DUE OUT for departure only.

get.description:
Use this API to find the status of rooms in a hotel.  You can narrow your results by specifying types of room, status of room and/or dates in the request.  The results will give you a list of rooms, and their current housekeeping details.  You could then go ahead and update any of these rooms by using postOutOfOrderRoom for example.

OperationId:getHousekeepingOverview

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Hotel Code for which Housekeeping overview needs to be fetched

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

parameters.name: housekeepingRoomStatus
parameters.description: Simple type for room status instructions to be used in requests for fetching housekeeping rooms. Valid status values are Clean, Dirty, Pickup, Inspected, OutOfOrder, OutOfService.

parameters.name: frontOfficeRoomStatus
parameters.description: Simple type for front office room status instructions to be used in requests for fetching housekeeping rooms. Valid values are Vacant and Occupied.

parameters.name: turndownStatus
parameters.description: Simple type for turndown status instructions to be used in requests for fetching housekeeping rooms. Valid status values are Required, Not Required and Completed.

parameters.name: roomParityStatus
parameters.description: Simple type for room parity instructions to be used in requests for fetching housekeeping rooms. Valid status values are Odd and Even.

parameters.name: fetchInstructions
parameters.description: Simple type for housekeeping instructions that can be used in requests for partial operations.

parameters.name: floor
parameters.description: The floor of room to be fetched.

parameters.name: roomType
parameters.description: Room Type of the Room.

parameters.name: roomClass
parameters.description: Room Class of the Room.

parameters.name: building
parameters.description: Building of the Room.

parameters.name: roomFeatures
parameters.description: Features of the Room.

parameters.name: daySection
parameters.description: AM Sections of the Room.

parameters.name: eveningSection
parameters.description: PM Sections of the Room.

parameters.name: reservationStatus
parameters.description: The status of the reservation to which this Room is assigned.

parameters.name: guestServiceRequest
parameters.description: Possible values for the Guest Service Status.

parameters.name: roomIdText
parameters.description: Wild Card entry for Room numbers to be Fetched.

parameters.name: excludeCombo
parameters.description: Indicates we need to exclude the combo rooms while fetching the housekeeping details.

get.description:
Use this API to get a list of rooms for a hotel that are Out of Order.  You can narrow down your results with search criteria such as Room class, Room Type, date range.

OperationId:getOutOfOrderRooms

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Hotel Code for which Out Of Order rooms needs to be fetched.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date for which the out of order / out of service rooms are to be fetched.

parameters.name: roomId
parameters.description: Room number to be Fetched.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for which the out of order / out of service rooms are to be fetched.

parameters.name: roomTypes
parameters.description: The room type of out of order / out of service rooms to be fetched.

parameters.name: roomClasses
parameters.description: The room class of out of order / out of service rooms to be fetched.

put.description:
Use this API when one or more rooms are no longer Out Of Order, and can now be available for a guest to stay in.  Specify in the request what status the room(s) should be returned to, such as clean, Inspected, dirty or Pickup.

OperationId:completeOutOfOrderRooms

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Hotel Code for which Out Of Order rooms needs to be returned to Clean, Inspected, Dirty or Pickup status.

200.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

post.summary: Set multiple rooms to Out Of Order
post.description:
This API allows you to initially set rooms to 'Out Of Order' housekeeping status and update existing outOfOrderRooms.

OperationId:postOutOfOrderRooms

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Hotel Code of Room(s) which is to be set as Out Of Order.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
Use this API when one or more rooms are no longer Out Of Service, and can now be available for a guest to stay in.  Specify in the request what status the room(s) should be returned to, such as clean, Inspected, dirty or Pickup.

OperationId:completeOutOfServiceRooms

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Hotel Code for which Out Of Service rooms needs to be returned to Clean, Inspected, Dirty or Pickup status.

200.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

get.description:
Use this API to get a list of rooms for a hotel that are Out of Service.  You can narrow down your results with search criteria such as Room class, Room Type, date range.

OperationId:getOutOfServiceRooms

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Hotel Code for which Out Of Service rooms needs to be fetched.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date for which the out of order / out of service rooms are to be fetched.

parameters.name: roomId
parameters.description: Room number to be Fetched.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for which the out of order / out of service rooms are to be fetched.

parameters.name: roomTypes
parameters.description: The room type of out of order / out of service rooms to be fetched.

parameters.name: roomClasses
parameters.description: The room class of out of order / out of service rooms to be fetched.

post.summary: Set multiple rooms to Out Of Service
post.description:
This API allows you to initially set rooms to 'Out Of Service' housekeeping status and update existing outOfServiceRooms.

OperationId:postOutOfServiceRooms

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Hotel Code of Room(s) which is to be set as Out Of Service.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
Use this API to update the housekeeping room status for multiple rooms.  Statuses typically include Inspected, Clean, Pickup or Dirty.

OperationId:putRoomRelatedStatus

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Hotel Code for which housekeeping room status, housekeeping status or turndown status have to be modified

200.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

authKey.name: authorization
authKey.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

x-hotelid.name: x-hotelid
x-hotelid.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in

housekeepingRooms.description: List of rooms and the room status.

hotelRoomsType.description: Collection of Room record that contain Housekeeping and Out Of Order information.

roomType.description: This type represents the primary room attributes.
Room type basic information of the room.

floorDescription.description: Description for the Floor of the Room.

roomDescription.description: Detail Long Description Of The Room.

smokingPreferenceDescription.description: This indicates the description of the room smoking preference.

roomAssignmentRating.description: Assignment Rating associated with the room.

isAccessible.description: Indicates whether the room is accessibility compliant.

meetingRoom.description: Indicates whether the room is a Meeting Room

outOfOrder.description: Identifies the room Out of Order/Out of Service information.

pseudoRoom.description: Indicates if room is a pseudoRoom. This is read-only.

isSuiteRoom.description: Indicates if room is a isSuiteRoom. This is read-only.

roomClass.description: Room Class of the room. This is read-only.

houseKeeping.description: Indicates if room type of the room is flagged as housekeeping. This is read-only.

smokingPreference.description: Specifies the smoking preference for room type of the room.

minimumOccupancy.description: Minimum occupancy for the room type.

maximumOccupancy.description: Maximum occupancy for the room type.

isAccessible.description: Indicates if room type is isAccessible.

meetingRoom.description: Indicates whether function space can be meeting room.

roomFeaturesType.description: A recurring element that identifies the room features.

code.description: A code representing a room feature.

description.description: A code representing a room feature.

translationTextType2000.description: Contains Multiple translated texts and language codes.

defaultText.description: Default text with Character length from 0 to 2000.

translatedTexts.description: List of translated text and language codes.

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 2000.

housekeepingRoomStatus.description: The Room status information per the reservation and housekeeping.

roomPersons.description: The Room person information per the reservation and housekeeping.

roomCondition.description: Condition of the room, if a condition was set.

linenChange.description: Indicates if a linen change is necessary.

facilityTaskCode.description: Facility task Code/ Task Code assigned to the room for the day.

reservationStatusList.description: List of status of the reservation to which this Room is assigned..

housekeepingRoomReservationStatusType.description: Room Reservation status types used in housekeeping. These may be different from the actual reservation statuses as these relate to the current reservation for the room.

housekeepingRoomStatusType.description: Simple type for room status instructions to be used in requests for fetching housekeeping rooms. Valid status values are Clean, Dirty, Pickup, Inspected, OutOfOrder, OutOfService.

frontOfficeRoomStatusType.description: Simple type for front office room status instructions to be used in requests for fetching housekeeping rooms. Valid values are Vacant and Occupied.

guestHousekeepingServiceRequestType.description: Possible values for the Guest Service Status.

roomCleaningPriorityType.description: Type to indicate the cleaning priority for a room.

prioritySequence.description: Priority sequence of the room for cleaning.

roomConditionType.description: Condition to be assigned on the room.

roomCondition.description: Code and Decription of Condition to be assigned on the room.

assignmentType.description: Determine if room, after applying condition, is available or not in Room Assignment listing.

codeDescriptionType.description: This contains a generic code and description information.

roomConditionAssigmentType.description: Simple type for Room Condition assignment type. Valid values are Available and NotAvailable Only.

roomsOutOfOrderType.description: Date Range and reasons for a room being Out of Order/Out Of Service (If the room is OO/OS).

roomOutOfOrderType.description: Out Of Order and Out Of Service Room information.

repairRemarks.description: Notes or Remarks on the OO/OS room

returnStatus.description: Room Status which will be used on completion of OO/OS.

reasonCode.description: Reason Code why the room is OO/OS.

reasonDescription.description: Reason Description why the room is OO/OS.

newDateRange.description: The new start date and end date, if the dates were changed as part of an update. This would be blank for new OO/OS rooms.

housekeepingRoomStatus.description: The out of order or out of service room status OO/OS.

start.description: The starting value of the date range.

end.description: The ending value of the date range.

dateRangeType.description: Date Range with Start and End dates.

start.description: The starting value of the date range.

end.description: The ending value of the date range.

roomDiscrepanciesType.description: Room Discrepancies between front office and housekeeping room status and number of persons in the room.

roomDiscrepancyType.description: Simple type for discrepant room status instructions to be used in requests for fetching housekeeping and front office room discrepancy. Valid values are Sleep, Skip, Person Discrepancy, Due Out Only.

roomRoomType.description: This type represents the primary room attributes.

roomType.description: Room type basic information of the room.

floorDescription.description: Description for the Floor of the Room.

roomDescription.description: Detail Long Description Of The Room.

smokingPreferenceDescription.description: This indicates the description of the room smoking preference.

roomAssignmentRating.description: Assignment Rating associated with the room.

startTime.description: The start time of the service.

status.description: Status of the respective Housekeeping Attendant.

hotelId.description: Property where this section is defined.

inactive.description: Indicates if the Section Code is active.

userSessionInfo.description: This is only used during log-in.

uniqueID_Type.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

birthDate.description: Indicates the date of birth as indicated in the document, in ISO 8601 prescribed format.

birthDateMasked.description: Indicates the date of birth as masked.

personNameType.description: This provides name information for a person.

namePrefix.description: Salutation of honorific (e.g. Mr., Mrs., Ms., Miss, Dr.)

givenName.description: Given name, first name or names.

middleName.description: The middle name of the person name.

surname.description: Family name, last name. May also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

nameSuffix.description: Hold various name suffixes and letters (e.g. Jr., Sr., III, Ret., Esq.)

nameTitleSuffix.description: Title Suffix. Must be populated if ADVANCED_TITLE is on.

nameType.description: Type of name of the individual, such as former, nickname, alternate or alias name.

externalSystem.description: When name type is external, indicates the external system the name belongs to.

personNameTypeType.description: Person's name in an external system.

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

isValidated.description: Indicator to define if the Address is validated by the Address Validation System.

addressLine.description: When the address is unformatted (FormattedInd="false") these lines will contain free form address details. When the address is formatted and street number and street name must be sent independently, the street number will be sent using StreetNmbr, and the street name will be sent in the first AddressLine occurrence.

cityName.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address).

cityExtension.description: Post Office City Extension Code number. City Extension mainly used for UK addresses.

county.description: County or District Name (e.g., Fairfax). This is read only.

type.description: Defines the type of address (e.g. home, business, other).

primaryInd.description: When true, indicates a primary information.

updateReservations.description: Indicates whether to update the reservations or not. If true and the address is primary, then all associated active reservations will be updated with the new primary address.

barCode.description: The postal barcode for the address.

creatorId.description: ID of creator. The creator could be a software system identifier or an identifier of an employee resposible for the creation.

lastModifierId.description: Identifies the last software system or person to modify a record.

purgeDate.description: Date an item will be purged from a database (e.g., from a live database to an archive).

countryNameType.description: Code for a country or a nationality.

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 200.

code.description: Code for a country or a nationality.

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

phoneUseType.description: Describes the type of telephone number, in the context of its general use (e.g. Home, Business, Emergency Contact, Travel Arranger, Day, Evening).

phoneNumber.description: Telephone number assigned to a single location.

extension.description: Extension to reach a specific party at the phone number.

primaryInd.description: When true, indicates a primary information.

creatorId.description: ID of creator. The creator could be a software system identifier or an identifier of an employee resposible for the creation.

lastModifierId.description: Identifies the last software system or person to modify a record.

purgeDate.description: Date an item will be purged from a database (e.g., from a live database to an archive).

parameterType.description: Name value pair type that will hold generic parameter information. Only use this type when the parameters being passed are too dynamic to be defined.

servicingAttendantStatusType.description: Possible values for the Status of a Servicing Attendant.

holdUntil.description: The date and time when hold will expire.

holdUser.description: User who placed room on hold.

turndownStatusType.description: Simple type for turndown status instructions to be used in requests for fetching housekeeping rooms. Valid status values are Required, Not Required and Completed.

guestName.description: Guest name that is registered for the reservation.

reservationId.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

url.description: URL that identifies the location associated with the record identified by the UniqueID.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

idContext.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

idExtension.description: Additional identifying value assigned by the creating system.

stayDateInfoType.description: Room attached with stay detail information

timeSpanType.description: Allows for a choice in description of the amount of time spanned by this type. EndDate specifies a specific date, while Duration provides a measure of time to add to the StartDate to yield end date.

resExpectedTimesType.description: Holds the Arrival and Departure Time Information

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 2000.

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

targetSchema.description: Link to the metadata of the resource, such as JSON-schema, that describes the resource expected when dereferencing the target resource..

operationId.description: The operationId of the path you can call to follow this link.  This allows you to look up not only the path and method, but the description of that path and any parameters you need to supply.

title.description: Exact copy of the "summary" field on the linked operation.

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

exceptionDetailType.title: Error Detail
exceptionDetailType.description: Complex type that contains error details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

o:errorDetails.description: Details of the error message, consisting of a hierarchical tree structure.

errorInstance.title: Error Instance Details
errorInstance.description: Complex type that contains error instance details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

tags.name: Housekeeping
tags.description: These APIs allows for retrieving and managing a room's housekeeping data and front office status, for example update room 101 to be Out Of Order.  Additionally, you can view room discrepancies between housekeeping and front office statuses, view and update task sheets and create a room service request.

externalDocs.description: Find out more about Oracle Hospitality
